column4: My sound suddently doesn't work in Ubuntu. What can I do to fix it?
install windows? =P
any serious suggestions?
run "dmesg | grep sound"
I did. It returns nothing.
but this is my sound device 0000:00:0b.0 Multimedia audio controller: Ensoniq 5880 AudioPCI (rev 02)
ok then... try sending randomness to it... "cat /dev/urandom > /dev/dsp"
are you trying to be funny again?
no, that's a way to test sound in *nix... it should produce noise
yes. I can imagine. Why shouldn't I just use bmp in stead?
might be an application config issue. This way we know that /dev/dsp works
well cat /dev/urandom > /dev/dsp gives no sound.
possibly a mixer issue?
ok? When cat /dev/urandom > /dev/dsp gives no sound?
on my home machine, there is some mixer control which blocks the sound when it's enabled
I just installed and ran aumix and checked that the volume was turned up.
ok
how do I check if something is blocking the sound?
yes! Now I got cat /dev/urandom > /dev/dsp to work!
excellent
thanks :=
